page.title: 01Trentham, Stoke-on-Trent
page.content: Trentham,mentioned in the original Domesday Book,lies at the southern edge of the City of Stoke-on-Trent. It is located either side of the A34, London to Manchester main road,at its junction with the A5035,Derby to Nottingham main road. Closeby runs the M6 Motorway; junction 15 links the motorway with the A34 and the City of Stoke-on-Trent. The main function of the area today is that of a dormitory suburb of the City of Stoke-on-Trent. Several new estates have been built in the last 25 years and many new houses are still under construction. Located in Trentham are Trentham Gardens,the famous former home of the Duke of Sutherland. Also located nearby is the Strongford Sewage Works which treats most of the sewage for the City of Stoke-on-Trent. The area has three schools,two primary and one high school.
